caption:
This photograph depicts a close-up view of a tree stump with a commemorative plaque mounted on it. The plaque, attached to a rugged, barked surface possibly belonging to another tree part or a structure made to look like a tree, reads "BIG CYPRESS BEND" and indicates that this specific location has been designated a registered natural landmark under the provisions of the 1962 Historic Sites Act. It acknowledges the area's exceptional value and significant role in the natural history of the United States. The designation was made by the U.S. Department of the Interior - National Park Service in 1966.

The tree stump itself is large, with a broad circumference and numerous growth rings visible, indicating its old age. The surface of the stump shows signs of weathering and age, with cracks and segments where pieces of the bark have fallen off. The surrounding area includes green foliage and some grass, suggesting that this landmark is in a wooded or forested setting. The photo emits a sense of historical solemnity and natural preservation, evoking an appreciation for the conservation efforts and the historical and ecological significance of the site.
title: Fakahatchee stRand of cypress in Big Cypress Bend, a national historic site
